marketNews.title: Poultry 2Q25: Pressured by Broiler and DOC Prices
marketNews.content: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia ($JPFA), Charoen Pokphand Indonesia ($CPIN), and Malindo Feedmill ($MAIN) recorded pressured performance throughout 2Q25, alongside a sharp decline in broiler and DOC prices amid demand that had not yet recovered. JPFA emerged as the best performer this quarter, while CPIN and MAIN experienced significant corrections, even recording operational losses in several lines. These results align with our previous outlook that the absence of the festive season (Eid) and the historical effect of the month of Suro potentially suppressed poultry prices. 1. JPFA: Net profit dropped in 2Q25 (-18% QoQ, -32% YoY), resulting in a 1H25 year-over-year decline of -16% and below expectations (43%/40% of 2025F Stockbit/Consensus estimates). 2. CPIN: Net profit plummeted in 2Q25 (-76% QoQ, -66% YoY), making the 1H25 realization grow +7% YoY and below expectations (42%/45% of 2025F Stockbit/Consensus estimates). 3. MAIN: Recorded its first quarterly loss since 1Q23 and a net profit decline of -91% YoY in 1H25. Here are some key highlights of the 2Q25 performance for the three issuers: 'Broiler' Segment: Only JPFA Remained Profitable JPFA recorded operating profit in the 'Broiler' segment of 292 billion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+14% QoQ), despite broiler prices plunging to 16,326 Rupiah per kg (-15% QoQ). Meanwhile, CPIN - historically the strongest - actually recorded an operating loss of 130 billion Rupiah, while MAIN recorded a loss of 77 billion Rupiah. 'DOC' Segment Weakened Simultaneously DOC prices fell to 4,196 Rupiah per head (-24% QoQ), causing all three issuers to record operating losses in this segment in 2Q25. JPFA remained the most resilient with a loss of 13 billion Rupiah, followed by MAIN with a loss of 45 billion Rupiah, while CPIN experienced the deepest loss of 197 billion Rupiah. Pressure Spreads to the 'Processed Chicken' Segment The 'Processed Chicken' segment was also pressured. Although JPFA and MAIN recorded year-over-year revenue growth in 2Q25, JPFA's operating profit weakened to 79 billion Rupiah (-36% YoY) and MAIN recorded another loss of 12 billion Rupiah (vs. 2Q24: loss of 14 billion Rupiah). Meanwhile, CPIN recorded a revenue decline of -17% QoQ and operating profit fell drastically to 46 billion Rupiah, after having posted a profit of 331 billion Rupiah in 1Q25. Key Takeaway With poultry price trends not yet recovering significantly amid still weak demand, we assess that acceleration of government spending is needed to boost demand and drive further price recovery in 2H25. In the medium to long term, the implementation of the Free Nutritious Meal program has the potential to structurally increase demand, if chicken products are included as part of the program. Since the release of CPIN and JPFA results on Thursday (31/7) afternoon, JPFA's stock price rose +5.31% and CPIN fell -3.25% on Friday (1/8). MAIN - which released its results on Thursday (31/7) morning - had already experienced a stock price decline of -8.8% until Friday (1/8). JPFA's stock outperformance can be attributed to its relatively most resilient performance compared to peers. MAIN itself will hold an earnings call on Friday (8/8) morning.

marketNews.title: BPS recorded that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia reached 2.37% YoY in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 1.87% YoY inflation), higher than the consensus expectation of 2.24% YoY and marking the highest annual inflation since June 2024. The expenditure groups that drove inflation were 'food, beverages, and tobacco' (3.75% YoY) and 'personal care and other services' (9% YoY), with contributions of 1.08 percentage point and 0.57 percentage point, respectively. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation reached 0.3% MoM (vs. June 2025: 0.19% YoY inflation). Meanwhile, core inflation in July 2025 eased to 2.32% YoY (vs. June 2025: 2.37% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.37% YoY.
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia reached 2.37% YoY on July 2025 (vs. June 2025: inflation 1.87% YoY), higher than the consensus expectation at the level of 2.24% YoY, simultaneously marking the highest annual inflation since June 2024. The expenditure groups that drove inflation were 'food, beverages, and tobacco' (3.75% YoY) and 'personal care and other services' (9% YoY), with contributions of 1.08 percentage point and 0.57 percentage point, respectively. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation reached 0.3% MoM (vs. June 2025: inflation 0.19% YoY). Meanwhile, core inflation in July 2025 eased to a level of 2.32% YoY (vs. June 2025: inflation 2.37% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation at the level of 2.37% YoY.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) stood at 49.2 in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 46.9), marking the fourth consecutive month of factory activity contraction. Output decline was slower compared to the last 4 months, but foreign demand returned to contraction territory after stabilizing in June 2025. Looking ahead, Indonesian producers show optimism about the outlook for the coming year, driven by hopes that the economy will improve and raw material prices will fall. However, the level of producer optimism sharply decreased compared to June 2025 and is the weakest since the Indonesian manufacturing PMI survey began in April 2012, accompanied by concerns regarding tariffs from the US and weak customer purchasing power. It should be noted that the July 2025 Indonesian manufacturing PMI survey was conducted between July 10-24, 2025, with almost all producer responses submitted before the announcement of the trade agreement with the US on July 22, 2025.
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) manufacturing Indonesia was at the level of 49.2 in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 46.9), marking the fourth consecutive month of factory activity contraction. The decline in output was recorded slower compared to the last 4 months, but foreign demand returned to contraction territory after stabilizing in June 2025. Going forward, Indonesian producers show optimism regarding the outlook for the coming year, driven by hopes that the economy will improve and raw material prices will fall. However, the level of producer optimism decreased sharply compared to June 2025 and is the weakest since the Indonesian manufacturing PMI survey began in April 2012, following concerns related to tariffs from the US and weak customer purchasing power. It should be noted, the Manufacturing PMI survey in Indonesia in July 2025 was conducted between July 10-24, 2025, with almost all producer responses submitted before the announcement of the trade agreement with the US on July 22, 2025.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing PMI fell to 49.5 in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 50.4), below the consensus expectation of 50.2. This decline was driven by a drop in production for the second time since October 2023, amid new export orders contracting for the 4th consecutive month with a faster decline than June 2025. Generally, producer optimism improved compared to June 2025, although still below the historical average.
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) manufacturing China fell to the level of 49.5 in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 50.4), below the consensus expectation at the level of 50.2. This decline was driven by a decrease in production for the second time since October 2023, amidst new export orders that contracted for the 4th consecutive month with a faster decline than June 2025. Overall, producer optimism improved compared to June 2025, although still below the historical average.

marketNews.title: BPS recorded that foreign tourist (wisman) visits to Indonesia reached ~1.4 million people in June 2025 (+18.2% YoY, +8.4% MoM). This result brought the total number of foreign tourist visits in 1H25 to grow +9.4% YoY to ~7.1 million people, equivalent to 44-50% of the government's 2025 target ranging between 14-16 million people.
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that foreign tourist (wisman) visits to Indonesia reached ~1.42 million people in June 2025 (+18.2% YoY, +8.4% MoM). This result made the total foreign tourist visits during 1H25 grow +9.4% YoY to ~7.1 million people, equivalent to 44-50% of the government's 2025 target in the range of 14-16 million people.

marketNews.title: Indika Energy (INDY) announced that its joint venture entity, PT Batu Ampar Container Terminal, has signed a cooperation agreement with PT Batam Terminal Petikemas to become a strategic partner in operating the Batu Ampar Container Terminal in Batam for 30 years. The estimated value of this agreement reaches 85 million USD. PT Batu Ampar Container Terminal itself is a joint venture entity between INDY's subsidiary, PT Interport Sarana Infrastruktur Indonesia, and ICTSI Middle East DMCC, with ownership stakes of 25% and 75%, respectively.
marketNews.content: Indika Energy ($INDY) announced that its joint venture entity, PT Batu Ampar Container Terminal, has signed a conditional agreement with PT Batam Terminal Petikemas to become a strategic partner in operating the Batu Ampar Container Terminal in Batam for 30 years. The estimated value of this agreement reaches 85 million USD. PT Batu Ampar Container Terminal itself is a joint venture entity between INDY's subsidiary, PT Interport Sarana Infrastruktur Indonesia, together with ICTSI Middle East DMCC, with respective ownership portions of 25% and 75%.

marketNews.title: Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) plans to distribute interim dividends for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~774.2 billion Rupiah or 39 Rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~2.6% as of Friday (1/8). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is August 11, 2025, while payment will be on August 29, 2025.
marketNews.content: Triputra Agro Persada ($TAPG) plans to distribute interim dividends for the 2025 fiscal year worth ~774.2 billion Rupiah or 39 Rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~2.6% as of Friday (1/8). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is August 11, 2025, while payment will be on August 29, 2025.

marketNews.title: PAM Mineral (NICL) Controller, Christopher Sumasto Tjia, bought 7.8 million NICL shares at an average price of 1,118 Rupiah per share on July 31, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~8.7 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.38% to ~0.45%.
marketNews.content: The controller of PAM Mineral ($NICL), Christopher Sumasto Tjia, bought 7.8 million NICL shares at an average price of 1,118 Rupiah per share on July 31, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~8.7 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct and indirect ownership in NICL increased from 0.38% to ~0.45%.

tickerNews.title: TLKM 1H25: Net Profit -7% YoY, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: TLKM: Telkom Indonesia recorded a net profit of 5.1 trillion Rupiah in 2Q25 (-10% YoY, -11% QoQ). This result brought the net profit during 1H25 to reach 11 trillion Rupiah (-7% YoY), below expectations (46% of consensus 2025F estimate). Operational performance looked weak, with operating profit in 2Q25 falling to 9.7 trillion Rupiah (-7% YoY, -4% QoQ). This result caused the operating profit during 1H25 to drop -8% YoY to 19.9 trillion Rupiah, below expectations (46% of consensus 2025F estimate). The number of '_mobile_' segment customers in 2Q25 decreased to 158.4 million (-0.9% YoY, -0.2% QoQ) with the associated segment's average revenue per user (ARPU) falling to 41.2 thousand Rupiah (-8% YoY, -3% QoQ). TLKM explained that this decrease was in line with expectations, consistent with the intention to reduce churn loops while maintaining discipline in controlling renewal package prices.

tickerNews.title: NCKL recorded a net profit of 2.4 trillion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+47.6% QoQ, +35.5% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations.
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada recorded a net profit of 2.4 trillion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+47.6% QoQ, +35.5% YoY). This result brought the net profit during 1H25 to reach 4.1 trillion Rupiah (+46.2% YoY), exceeding expectations (59.6% of consensus 2025F estimate). Although quarterly revenue fell by -2.2% QoQ, net profit still grew due to a decrease in the cost of revenue (-13.9% QoQ) and operating expenses (-16.4% QoQ), so that gross profit margin and operating profit margin rose to 37.9% (vs 1Q25: 29.5%) and 33.9% (vs 1Q25: 24.8%), respectively. The decrease in the cost of revenue was primarily driven by inventory value movements, resulting in lower average selling costs in 2Q25. Furthermore, gains from associated entities also increased by +93.7% QoQ, mainly derived from an increase in the share of profit from Halmahera Persada Legend (+122% QoQ) and PT Karunia Permai Sentosa (+788% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: SIDO recorded a net profit of 368 billion Rupiah in 2Q25, exceeding expectations for 1H25 performance.
tickerNews.content: SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul recorded a net profit of 368 billion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+69% YoY, +58% QoQ). This result brought the net profit during 1H25 to reach 600 billion Rupiah (-1% YoY), exceeding expectations (53% of consensus 2025F estimate). The annual surge in net profit in 2Q25 was primarily caused by significantly recovered revenue (+23% YoY, +32% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 revenue decreasing by -4% YoY. The strong revenue recovery also boosted the gross profit margin to 60.5% in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: 52.3%; 2Q24: 56.8%). Meanwhile, opex decreased by -18% YoY in 2Q25, so operating profit rose +73% YoY in 2Q25, although operating profit during 1H25 was still down -4% YoY due to the burden of weak performance in 1Q25.

tickerNews.title: INTP net profit rose 44% YoY in 2Q25, remaining relatively in line with expectations, supported by rising blended average selling prices.
tickerNews.content: INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a net profit of 284 billion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+44% YoY, +35% QoQ). This result brought the net profit during 1H25 to reach 495 billion Rupiah (+14% YoY), relatively in line with expectations (26% of consensus 2025F estimate vs. average of the last 2 years: 29% annual realization). Gross profit margin grew +250 bps/+90 bps YoY in 2Q25/1H25, along with an average selling price increase of +2% YoY. In the earnings call on Friday (1/8), INTP management explained that the increase in selling price was driven by the increasing proportion of bagged cement in the product mix. However, the company does not plan to make aggressive selling price adjustments. Gross profit margin performance was also supported by the cost of revenue per ton falling -4% YoY in 2Q25, although it was flat over 1H25. Opex was relatively stable in 2Q25, so over 1H25 it decreased by -2% YoY. Revenue tended to stagnate in 2Q25 (+0.4% YoY) and 1H25 (-1% YoY) due to flat sales volume in 2Q25 (+1% YoY) and declining sales volume during 1H25 (-3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTBA recorded a net profit of 442 billion Rupiah in 2Q25, below consensus expectations for 1H25.
tickerNews.content: PTBA: Bukit Asam recorded a net profit of 442 billion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+12.8% QoQ, -64.4% YoY). This result brought the net profit during 1H25 to reach 833 billion Rupiah (-59% YoY), below expectations (22.8% of consensus 2025F estimate). The quarterly increase in net profit in 2Q25 was due to an increase in revenue (+5.4% QoQ) and a rise in the operating profit margin to 4.8% (vs. 1Q25: 3.5%). PTBA also recorded improvements in gross profit margin and operating profit margin along with a more moderate increase in the cost of revenue (+4.3% QoQ) and a decrease in operating expenses (-0.7% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Petrosea (PTRO) announced signing an agreement to acquire an entire stake in HBS PNG Limited, a Papua New Guinea-based company involved in mining and construction services and heavy equipment, for a total transaction value of 25.8 million USD, as part of business diversification strategy.
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea announced that it has signed a conditional agreement to acquire all shares of HBS PNG Limited, a Papua New Guinea company engaged in mining and construction services and heavy equipment, with a total transaction value of 25.8 million US Dollars. PTRO explained that this acquisition is part of the company's business development strategy abroad and diversification into the gold mineral sector.

tickerNews.title: Astra International (ASII) purchased approximately 313 million HEAL shares between July 25-31, 2025, increasing its ownership stake to ~10%.
tickerNews.content: HEAL: Shareholders of Medikaloka Hermina, Astra International ($ASII), purchased approximately 313 million HEAL shares with an average price of 1,572 Rupiah per sheet on July 25-31, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 493 billion Rupiah and was carried out through its subsidiary, PT Astra Healthcare Indonesia. After this transaction, Astra's direct and indirect ownership in HEAL increased from ~7.96% to ~10%.
